page.title: 03PIG FARMING IN BURTON PIDSEA
page.content: MANOR FARM Manor Farm has 5816 pigs at the present time. The pigs are arranged in pens according to age and size. Sows weigh, on average, 300 pounds whilst piglets weigh only 3 pounds at birth. They are usually kept with the mother for three weeks. When the piglets are born they have to be de-tailed and have their teeth clipped. This is to stop them from hurting the mother when feeding. They also have to have an identification number put in their ear. Piglets are usually born in very large litters and some are born dead. Others die soon after birth. Sometimes the mother is clumsy and she lays on a piglet. To avoid this, the sow is held in her pen by movable bars.
